main event: A civilian in O'Fallon, Missouri reported a bright, star-like object stationary in the sky, which was later identified as the planet Venus.
interesting points: The object appeared to be round, white, and larger than the North Star.
The witness reported that the object appeared at the same time every evening.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies with varying winds aloft.
The report provided detailed information about Venus and other celestial objects visible in the night sky.
It mentioned the upcoming Geminid meteor shower, which would also be visible in the evening sky.
